Terms of Service for Watt Events

Last updated: 11/13/2023

1. Acceptance of Terms

Watt Events ("us", "we", or "our") operates the www.wattevent.com website (the "Service"). The following terms and conditions govern all use of our Service and all content, services, and products available at or through the website.

By accessing or using the Service, you ("User", "you", or "your") agree to be bound by these Terms. If you disagree with any part of the terms, then you may not access the Service.

2. Changes to Terms

We reserve the right to modify or replace these Terms at any time at our sole discretion. Your continued use of the Service after any such changes constitutes your acceptance of the new Terms.

3. Service Description

The Service includes the rental of casino equipment and accessories for entertainment purposes only. No real money gambling is offered or implied, and all activities are for event entertainment purposes.

4. Use of Service

You agree to use the Service only for lawful purposes and in accordance with the Terms. Watt Events is not responsible for any gaming or gambling activities that may occur beyond the scope of the Service provided.

5. Termination

We may terminate or suspend access to our Service immediately, without prior notice or liability, for any reason whatsoever, including, without limitation, if you breach the Terms.

6. Governing Law

These Terms are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California, without regard to its conflict of law provisions.

7. Disclaimer of Warranties

The Service is provided "as is". Watt Events and its suppliers and licensors hereby disclaim all warranties of any kind, express or implied, including, without limitation, the warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose and non-infringement.

8. Limitation of Liability

In no event will Watt Events, or its suppliers or licensors, be liable with respect to any subject matter of this agreement under any contract, negligence, strict liability or other legal or equitable theory for: (i) any special, incidental or consequential damages; (ii) the cost of procurement for substitute products or services; (iii) for interruption of use or loss or corruption of data.

9. Changes to the Service

Watt Events reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to modify or discontinue the Service without notice at any time.

10. Contact Us

If you have any questions about these Terms, please contact us.

); }; export default TermsOfService;
